result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor Steger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
2.  NO contact with the victim - Linda R.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor Steger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Agent Christensen dated March 6, 2015 - defendant has paid off all her court obligations and has completed all her court ordered conditions

AND NOTICE FOR HEARING - PROBATION REVIEW/EXTENSION 973.09(3)(b)

Discharge Date - 05/20/2015
Obligations due - $376.81

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
3:48 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney John Selsing.

ADA moves to amend to a misdemeanor of concealing stolen property in violation of 943.34(1)(a).  Attorney Selsing concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.   Court goes over the elements of the offense and as a PTAC.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the amended charge and as a PTAC and judgment of conviction to be entered today.  ADA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.  Sentencing statement by Linda R.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Selsing.  No statement by the defendant.

Court orders SWD and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Abide with all other rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.
Pay court costs
Perform 20 hours of community service.
NO contact with the victim - Linda R.  Court instructs regarding forms of no contact.

Court adjourned at 4:03 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on May 20, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Per MP in the DA's office, set for Pretrial Conference on May 9, 2014 at 9:00 a.m.  No Notices.
43

11:23 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Brandenf.  Defendant present with Attorney John Selsing.

Statement by Attorney Selsing.  Court directs preliminary hearing be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 11:24 a.m.
Status hearing on April 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Per Deb at PD's office, Atty John Selsing has been appointed to represent the defendant.
43
Status hearing on March 25, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:19 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing regarding counsel in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 9:21 a.m.
